content:
Possible Issues

  • Biased, flawed reasoning, or logical fallacy
    • Fallacy (formal or informal, invalid/illogical) - An issue on the reasoning or conclusion (not about the truthfulness)
    • Extreme or false generalization - example: Shows a video about addiction and concludes: Everything we know about addiction is wrong.
    • Bias - prejudice in favor of or against one thing, person, or group compared with another that results to flawed reasoning.
    • Misleading - implying it has presented the complete picture and presents a conclusion event if that is not the case.
  • Unwelcome content
    • Illegal
    • Involuntary pornography
    • Encourages or incites violence
    • Threatens, harasses, or bullies or encourages others to do so
    • Personal and confidential information
    • Impersonates someone in a misleading or deceptive manner
    • Spam
    • Exhibiting malicious intent
  • Other Issue - Grammar or spelling issue, unorganized content structure, any other issue
    • Composite argument - An entry containing multiple independent claims not representing a primary claim or argument; except for public material

title: Possible Issues
